conclusion: Analyze the paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Liquid from A encounters a horizontal red baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from A flows down and reaches the bottom, where it can enter container D.
Liquid from B encounters a horizontal gray baffle directing it to the left.
Liquid from B flows down and reaches the bottom, where it can enter container E.
Liquid from C encounters a horizontal gray baffle directing it to the left.
Liquid from C flows down and reaches the bottom, where it can enter container E.
Liquid from A will flow into container D.
Liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
Container D will receive liquid from A.
Container E will receive liquid from B and C.
